qas.question: Which borough of New York hosts the US Open Tennis championships?
The Wanamaker Mile is an event by which annual track and field meeting?
The oldest, longest horse races in the US are located in NYC called what?
Which years did NYC host the PGA golf championships?
The Amateur Boxing Golden Gloves are held at which location in NYC?
In what borough is the National Tennis Center located?
What tennis Grand Slam event is held at the National Tennis Center?
How many people completed the New York Marathon in 2006?
What annual sporting competition features the Wanamaker Mile?
At what venue does the Amateur Boxing Golden Gloves take place?

context: The annual <a6_0>United States Open Tennis Championships<a6_0/> is one of the world's four Grand Slam tennis tournaments and is held at the National Tennis Center in Flushing Meadows-Corona Park, <a0_0><a5_0>Queens<a5_0/><a0_0/>. The New York Marathon is one of the world's largest, and the 2004–2006 events hold the top three places in the marathons with the largest number of finishers, including <a7_0>37,866<a7_0/> finishers in 2006. The <a1_0><a8_0>Millrose Games<a8_0/><a1_0/> is an annual track and field meet whose featured event is the Wanamaker Mile. Boxing is also a prominent part of the city's sporting scene, with events like the Amateur Boxing Golden Gloves being held at <a4_0><a9_0>Madison Square Garden<a9_0/><a4_0/> each year. The city is also considered the host of the <a2_0>Belmont Stakes<a2_0/>, the last, longest and oldest of horse racing's Triple Crown races, held just over the city's border at Belmont Park on the first or second Sunday of June. The city also hosted the 1932 U.S. Open golf tournament and the <a3_0>1930 and 1939<a3_0/> PGA Championships, and has been host city for both events several times, most notably for nearby Winged Foot Golf Club.
